channel.title: Memory leak
channel.description: im using torvapkz there si a regular runserver thena memload (fixed) i would think the memleak (fixed) would run better but it still is laggy around 10 people

item.title: Memory leak
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

When you create new objects in Java that don’t end when they are supposed to, allocate [10000] NPC spots when only [2000] are needed etc. this is also a memory leak.

I’ve found out that you can’t have stability and content in a server at the same time because both take a long time to do properly. I don’t think any servers have been developed that long before being released unfinished…

It’s starting to make me wonder if the RSPS scene is “where it’s at”?

Read full topic

item.title: Memory leak
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

You did something the client doesn’t support. Like try drawing a model higher than the client supports.

Read full topic

item.title: Memory leak
item.dc:creator: @soldierslim2 soldierslim2
item.description:
@soldierslim2 wrote:

ok now whats this i keep getting it in my cmd :mad: in client

Exception in thread "Thread-5" java.lang.NullPointerException at client.method119(client.java:10798) at client.drawGameScreen(client.java:9617) at client.processDrawing(client.java:10465) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:108) at client.run(client.java:6027) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)

Read full topic

item.title: Memory leak
item.dc:creator: @Anc13ntsIsBack Anc13ntsIsBack
item.description:
@Anc13ntsIsBack wrote:

If you have memory leaks in Java, please leave.

Read full topic

item.title: Memory leak
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

… :fp: A noob way to fix a memory leak is just to allocate more memory to the program. That way the JVM won’t say “Insufficient memory”. Obviously this isn’t a permanent fix, because the longer a program that leaks memory is open, the more memory it uses. I’m not talking about your Random Access Memory, I’m talking about this:

-Xmx512m

Read full topic

item.title: Memory leak
item.dc:creator: @Mr.czar Mr.czar
item.description:
@Mr.czar wrote:

Both runs run the same memory for each player as for my system it uses at about 0.30% for each player in the fixed mem, I run about 0.32% I seen this and seen it’s pretty much the same even tho regular run seemed to be lower, as I just tested this.

Read full topic

item.title: Memory leak
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Mr.czar:

This mostly depends on your RAM and computer. All of the runs in torva pkz are the same, except the gui run.

I thought the memleak (fixed) just allocated more memory to the JVM? If it is the same as all of the others, then this must not be true…

Read full topic
